text: Caroline E. Janney is an American historian. She is John L. Nau III Professor of the American Civil War at the University of Virginia. She won the 2022 Lincoln Prize. == Life == Janney graduated from University of Virginia. She taught at Purdue University. == Works == * Burying the Dead but Not the Past: Ladies’ Memorial Associations (2008) * Lost Cause; Remembering the Civil War: Reunion and the Limits of Reconciliation, (2013) * Appomattox: The End of the War in Virginia. (2018) * Ends of War: The Unfinished Fight of Lee’s Army after Appomattox (The University of North Carolina Press, 2021) == References == == Other websites == * Caroline Janney Interview: Abraham Lincoln's Understanding * https://naucenter.as.virginia.edu/blogs/caroline-janney * Category:American historians Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Purdue University faculty Category:University of Virginia faculty
title: Caroline Janney
